title: Senior Motion Designer
content:
As our new Senior Motion Designer, you’ll lead motion (2D, 3D) projects while providing mentorship and support to a team of 1-3 Motion Designers.
You’ll be part of an international team, composed of some of the most talented makers, producers, and creative minds in the industry. These are people who aspire to architect the future of experience – imagining, creating, and executing meaningful connections with people in forward-thinking ways. We are looking for someone who embodies our values of community, curiosity, passion, positivity, and teamwork with a track record of delivery.
Required Skill Set
You’ll be responsible for 2D & 3D animations, design, sharing your passion for Art and Technology,  and being a bit of a generalist with a well-rounded understanding of compositing and video post-production for our clients worldwide (including but not limited to Facebook, Google, Adidas, Ford, Coke, Fox, Disney).
Creative Skills

Use your keenly developed aesthetic sense and practitioners background in design & animation to lead multiple motion-based projects with tight timelines
Collaborate with the UX, Design, Strategy, and Development team to uncover creative solutions through motion design
You will work alongside our developers, designers, producers, directors & to create world-class experiences such as AR, VR, digital & experiential projects. Delivering high-end motion content.
Conceptualize animated content optimized for OOH, web, apps & social channels
Interpret creative briefs & translate them into compelling reference libraries, style frames, and  motion concepts with the ability to articulate your ideas
Assist Creative Directors with various pitch &  project needs as assigned
Ability to work in editing cycles, from time to time you’ll be asked to edit videos and color-grade (ie. Case studies, live-action advertising)

Soft Skills

Bring your “A-game” as a self-starter, problem solver & team-player; with strong communication & presentation skills with the ability to convey creative concepts to clients
Communicate concepts to Creative Directors via links, mood boards, sketches & motion tests before commencing on design. Will be asked to defend decisions and articulate design choices
Be eager to push the limits within your work and your personal development
Provide mentorship and support to a team of 1-3 Motion Designers

Workflow

Develop creative programs & motion design processes that help production flow
Ability to forecast possible issues in projects 
Provide project budgets (time and cost) estimates to Executive Producers
Responsible for producing and delivering motion elements in interactive projects 

Be prepared to talk about:

Your 4-6 years of experience in video editing & motion design, using After Effects, Cinema 4D Premiere Pro, Photoshop, Illustrator, 2D animation & 3D camera. Basic Expressions, Particles, and Post Effects 

Bonus if you can talk about:

Advanced experience with Cinema 4D or Maya
Understanding of Unity & Unreal would be an asset
Advanced understanding of animation principles
Experience rendering using Redshift or Octane rendering engines
Advanced Compositing ( Types of passes, export from 3D software, 2D & 3D tracking )
Knowledge of Mixamo Character Rigging, X-Particles, Red Giant Plug-ins
Excellent understanding of grid systems and typographic layout

#LI-FC1 #LI-MP1 #LI-HybridAbout Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
